question_sentence: According to a recent ranking, which is the world’s most expensive city?
evidence: For the third year in a row, Hong Kong received the dubious title of “priciest city in the world,” according to an analysis this week by global mobility company ECA International. The company calculates the list based on several factors, including the average price of groceries, rent, utilities, public transit and the strength of the local currency.

question_sentence: The baby formula manufacturing plant at the center of the nationwide shortage recently restarted production of certain formulas. Why was the facility closed for several months?
evidence: Abbott’s Michigan-based facility was shut down for months following an FDA inspection that found dangerous bacteria – which can be deadly to infants – in several areas of the plant.

question_sentence: Which golfer won the 2022 US Women’s Open?
evidence: Minjee Lee won the US Women’s Open. It’s the second major win for the 26-year-old golf star.

question_sentence: According to a recent California ruling, which insect can legally be considered a fish and have the same protections?
evidence: A California court has ruled bees can legally be considered fish under specific circumstances. The expansion of the definition of fish to include invertebrates makes bees eligible for greater protection from the Fish and Game Commission, wrote the court.

question_sentence: Which department store chain put itself up for sale this week?
evidence: Kohl’s announced Monday it has entered into a negotiation period for a potential sale. Franchise Group, a holding company that owns a number of retail brands, has proposed to buy Kohl’s in a deal valued at around $8 billion.

question_sentence: Which California city voted this week to recall its district attorney amid growing concerns about theft and an alarming spate of hate crimes directed against Asian Americans?
evidence: San Francisco voters recalled District Attorney Chesa Boudin. Boudin, who was narrowly elected in 2019, faced criticism from an overwhelming number of San Francisco residents who feel that crime is out of control and is not a priority for the district attorney.

question_sentence: After a 10-month investigation, a House select committee began unveiling a series of long-awaited details pertaining to who?
evidence: The House select committee investigating the January 6 insurrection at the US Capitol is zeroing in on former President Donald Trump and is preparing to use its platform to argue that he was responsible for grave abuses of power that nearly upended US democracy.

question_sentence: Which popular celebrity doctor won Pennsylvania’s Senate GOP primary?
evidence: Mehmet Oz, the celebrity heart surgeon also known as Dr. Oz, won Pennsylvania’s Senate GOP primary by a narrow 951 votes. Oz received 419,999 votes (31.1%) while his challenger Dave McCormick received 419,048 votes (31.0%), according to the commonwealth’s acting secretary of state.

question_sentence: Which late-night talk show did President Joe Biden make his first in-person appearance on this week?
evidence: President Biden stopped by “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” and jumped right into a conversation about politics and gun control. The two also spoke about inflation, rising gas prices and Roe v. Wade.

question_sentence: Which politician survived a vote of confidence this week that threatened to remove him from office?
evidence: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson survived a vote of confidence triggered by discontented lawmakers in his own party for hosting gatherings during the country’s Covid-19 lockdown. A total of 211 Conservative MPs voted to keep Johnson as the party leader, while 148 voted for his removal.

question_sentence: Four months after the Kamila Valieva saga at the Olympics, minimum age for senior figure skating competition has been raised to:
Which country’s leader did not attend President Biden’s Summit of the Americas this week?
"Jurassic World: Dominion," released this week, is the latest film in the franchise. How many movies are there in the series?
Apple announced new iPhone features coming with iOS 16 at this week’s WWDC event. All of these are new additions except:
choices: Editing messages after they are sent
Ability to enhance images after zooming in

question_sentence: Which one of these golfers has NOT announced that they will play in LIV Golf Invitational events?
Monday was the anniversary of D-Day, when Allied forces stormed the beaches of Normandy in Nazi-occupied France. How many years ago was it?
As part of a new pilot program in the United Kingdom, thousands of workers are testing out a different work week. How long is it?
Which actor spoke out against gun violence in the United States during a speech at the White House this week?
Three abortion activists stripped down to their underwear in protest, interrupting which event?
The latest dubious TikTok trend requires just two ingredients to make a so-called "healthier" version of Coca-Cola: Sparkling water and what?
Boris Johnson is attempting to reset his premiership after a confidence vote saw how many Tory MPs oppose his leadership?
evidence: More than 40% of Conservative MPs voted in opposition to Johnson’s leadership, giving him a lower margin of victory than Theresa May in December 2018

question_sentence: Which legendary guitarist did Johnny Depp join on tour after his libel trial against Amber Heard concluded last week?
evidence: Depp joined Jeff Beck on the last leg of his UK tour and Beck then announced that the Hollywood actor will appear on his forthcoming album

question_sentence: According to the BBC, the ‘biggest rail strike in modern history’ is set to take place at the end of June, with how many staff expected to walk out?
evidence: The National Union of Rail, Maritime and Transport Workers (RMT) has told members to strike after talks over pay and redundancies fell through

question_sentence: Two-time grand slam champion Iga Swiatek beat which tennis player in the French Open women’s final last weekend?
evidence: ESPN.com said the Pole showed ‘blistering, athletic play’ to dismantle ‘teenage phenom’ Gauff, winning the ‘first four games of the match – and never looked back’

question_sentence: Boris Johnson is planning to revive the Right to Buy scheme, but when was it first introduced?
evidence: The first iteration of the scheme was a flagship policy of Margaret Thatcher’s government. Now, housing association tenants may gain similar rights to those in council houses

question_sentence: A British geologist has been jailed for trying to smuggle artefacts out of Iraq, but how long has been sentenced to?
evidence: Jim Fitton is facing 15 years in prison after being charged with collecting fragments during an organised archeology tour and attempting to take them out of the country

question_sentence: How much did a commemorative book given to schoolchildren in the UK to mark the Queen’s Platinum  Jubilee reportedly cost to publish and distribute?
evidence: The Department for Education reportedly spent £12m on the publication of Queen Elizabeth: A Platinum Jubilee Celebration

question_sentence: Ben Stokes began his reign as England’s Test cricket captain this week. Who did England beat in the first Test of the summer at Lord’s?
evidence: Stokes got off to a ‘perfect, winning start’, said The Times, after England emerged victorious against New Zealand

question_sentence: Producers of Love Island, which returned to TV screens this week, have ditched the show’s previous fast-fashion sponsors for which online marketplace?
evidence: Contestants will be wearing second-hand garments during season eight. Hear what fashion industry experts have to say about the news on The Overview podcast

question_sentence: A bakery in Kyiv, Ukraine has named a sweet treat after a world leader, but which of these is it?
choices: A macaron named after Emmanuel Macron
A croissant named after Boris Johnson
A strudel named after Olaf Scholz
evidence: Cafe Zavertailo has bestowed Johnson’s name on a bestselling pastry, which features meringue and a scoop of ice cream to represent the prime minister’s hair
